sentences.en: A MORI poll showed that 68% of people opposed the ban.
sentences.cn: 摩利公司的民意测验显示，有68%的人反对这一禁令。

sentences.en: an approach that is theoretical as opposed to practical.
sentences.cn: 一种理论上而不是实践上的方法。

sentences.en: He reacted testily to reports that he'd opposed military involvement.
sentences.cn: 有报道称他反对军队参与，对此他很是恼火。

sentences.en: He was staunchly opposed to a public confession.
I am passionately opposed to the death penalty.
I am utterly opposed to any form of terrorism.
sentences.cn: 我坚决反对任何形式的恐怖主义。

sentences.en: I opposed her marriage to Darryl.
Most of us are opposed to the death penalty.
sentences.cn: 我们大多数人都反对死刑。

sentences.en: Mr Clarke has shown himself to be resolutely opposed to compromise.
sentences.cn: 克拉克先生已表示自己坚决反对妥协。

sentences.en: Mr Taylor was not bitter towards those who had opposed him.
sentences.cn: 泰勒先生对那些曾反对过他的人并未怀恨在心。

sentences.en: Only 18 percent of those surveyed opposed the idea.
sentences.cn: 被调查者中只有18%的人反对该主张。

sentences.en: She remained bitterly opposed to the idea of moving abroad.
sentences.cn: 她仍然强烈反对移居国外。

sentences.en: She was opposed to new laws to muzzle the press.
sentences.cn: 她反对钳制新闻界言论的新法律。

sentences.en: The enemy chieftain was opposed and deserted by his followers.
The principles of capitalism and socialism are diametrically opposed (= completely opposite ).
sentences.cn: 资本主义的原则与社会主义的原则截然相反。

sentences.en: They came to conclusions diametrically opposed to ours.
sentences.cn: 他们得出了与我们完全相反的结论。

sentences.en: This was a straight conflict of directly opposed aims.
sentences.cn: 这是完全对立的目标之间的正面冲突。

sentences.en: We ate in the restaurant, as opposed to the bistro.
sentences.cn: 我们是在餐厅吃的饭，而不是在小饭馆。

words.tran_cn: 反向地；在相反的位置；面对面
反对；反对派；在野党；敌对
反对（oppose的过去分词）；使对立

trans.tran_cn: 强烈反对某事物的，（表示对比）而，相对于，相反的，敌对的
trans.tran_en: to disagree with something such as a plan or system
